events.name: Feb/2015 - Open Space (Working with Customers)
events.description: Having a theme in Open Space seems to work pretty well! This time, I'm going to try another theme, inspired and adapted from Agile Conference 2014 . Open Space Theme: Working with Customers This theme focuses on: 1) How to identify and engage your customers - internal users, external clients, product managers, project sponsors etc.. Each of these groups have different needs and building a product without engaging each of them can be disastrous. 2) How to build the “right product”, how to validate and ensure that we are actually delivering value to our customers. Agenda 7:00pm - Food 7:30pm - Generate topics and schedule 8:00pm - Breakout to topic sessions 10:00pm - End We welcome contributions of drinks and snacks! =) What is Open Space? Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where topics are generated on the spot and discussed by the participants through breakout sessions. For more information read Open Space Technology . Getting There Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2 is just right above of Downtown station along Downtown Line (DT) .
events.location: Barclays, 10 Marina Boulevard, #23-01, Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2, Singapore

events.name: 4th Docker Meetup @ Paypal
events.description: We are back with the second meetup which Paypal has generously agreed to host. We are having three talks this time, the details for which are: 1. Tran Binh Ngoc, Software Engineer, Zopim : On building one-click-app deployment tool with docker. (Think digital ocean meets heroku) 2. Chris Heng, Software Engineer, Pie : Docker on a Diet - tips on removing bloat from Docker Images. 3. Vincent Serpoul, Tech. Lead, Paypal Singapore : A lean, simple yet efficient docker stack
events.location: PayPal Singapore, Millenia Tower, 1 Temasek Avenue, Level 14, Singapore 039192

events.name: February Meetup
events.description: Hello! It's the festive season again but we are not going to miss a Ruby meetup! Our next meetup is on February 24th, 7pm at PayrollHero's office. Venue: 6th Floor, Ocean Financial Centre, 10 Collyer Quay * Note: Please bring an ID to get an elevator pass from the reception. See you there! -------------- 1. Testing Shell Scripts - Bjorn Andersson / @gaqzi 2. Development to Devops - Justin Burris / @justinbburris 3. 5 Random Ruby Tips - Akira Hirakawa * Hot Picks - This is a 5-10 minute session during which anyone can stand up and say something interesting! -------------- Would you like to speak at our future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack, your new RubyGem, or your opinions on best practices, so that people can get to know how awesome you are! We also have a 5min section on "5 Random Ruby Tips" that you can volunteer for - I am sure you must have came across some interesting Ruby nuggets in the last month right? So don't be shy! Step forward and share your knowledge! Ping Winston @winstonyw or winstonyw@gmail.com, or Anna @anna_fil or annafil@gmail.com. See you all soon! -------------- Job Postings -------------- Are you looking for Rubyists? Do you have a job posting? Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it here. -------------- Thank You, Sponsors! Food, Venue and Drinks: P ayrollHero
events.location: PayrollHero , 6th Floor, Ocean Financial Centre, 10 Collyer Quay, Singapore
